title: CVPR_2008_258_abs

sentences.text: We propose a novel step toward the unsupervised seg-mentation of whole objects by combining '' hints '' of partial scene segmentation offered by multiple soft , binary mattes .
These mattes are implied by a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments in the scene .
Rather than trying to find or define a single '' best '' segmentation , we generate multiple segmentations of an image .

This reflects contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images , and it allows us to define intuitive evaluation met-rics for our sets of segmentations based on the accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects .
Our proposed approach builds on recent advances in spectral clustering , image matting , and boundary detection .
It is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes and is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge .

Entity-our_proposed_approach.label: Our proposed approach
Entity-our_proposed_approach.description: Our proposed approach refers to a novel methodology for unsupervised segmentation of whole objects that integrates hints from partial scene segmentation using multiple soft binary mattes, leveraging advances in spectral clustering, image matting, and boundary detection.

Entity-partial_scene_segmentation.label: partial scene segmentation
Entity-partial_scene_segmentation.description: Partial scene segmentation refers to an image processing technique that utilizes hints from multiple soft binary mattes to assist in the unsupervised segmentation of whole objects within a scene, focusing on the delineation of scene objects through hypothesized boundary fragments.

Entity-multiple_soft__binary_matte.label: multiple soft, binary mattes
Entity-multiple_soft__binary_matte.description: Multiple soft, binary mattes refer to a technique used in image processing that generates various partial segmentations of a scene by utilizing soft masks that indicate the presence of objects, derived from hypothesized boundary fragments, to aid in unsupervised object discovery.

Entity-a_novel_step.label: a novel step
Entity-a_novel_step.description: A novel step refers to an innovative approach in the field of unsupervised segmentation of whole objects, which involves integrating hints from partial scene segmentation through multiple soft binary mattes derived from hypothesized object boundary fragments.

Entity-whole_object.label: whole objects
Entity-whole_object.description: Whole objects refer to complete entities in a scene that are targeted for unsupervised segmentation using hints from partial scene segmentation techniques, which involve the use of soft binary mattes derived from hypothesized object boundaries.

Entity-contemporary_method_for_unsupervi.label: contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery
aliases: contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery
Entity-contemporary_method_for_unsupervi.description: Contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery refer to advanced techniques that leverage multiple segmentations and partial scene information to identify and delineate objects in images without the need for labeled data, utilizing approaches such as spectral clustering and image matting.

mentions.local_name: contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery

Entity-current_work_in_unsupervised_obje.label: current work in unsupervised object discovery
aliases: current work in unsupervised object discovery
Entity-current_work_in_unsupervised_obje.description: Current work in unsupervised object discovery refers to contemporary methods and approaches aimed at segmenting and identifying objects in images without the use of predefined labels or top-down knowledge, utilizing techniques such as spectral clustering and image matting to generate multiple segmentations based on partial scene information.

mentions.local_name: current work in unsupervised object discovery

Entity-multiple_segmentation.label: multiple segmentations
Entity-multiple_segmentation.description: Multiple segmentations refer to the generation of various possible segmentations of an image, which are produced as part of an unsupervised segmentation approach that utilizes hints from partial scene segmentations and aims to facilitate object discovery without relying on predefined boundaries.

Entity-unsupervised_object_discovery_wit.label: unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge
aliases: unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge
Entity-unsupervised_object_discovery_wit.description: The phrase 'unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge' refers to a method for segmenting whole objects in images using partial scene segmentation hints, without relying on predefined categories or external guidance.

mentions.local_name: unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge

Entity-matte.label: mattes
Entity-matte.description: Mattes refer to soft, binary representations used in image processing to indicate partial scene segmentation, derived from hypothesized object boundary fragments.

Entity-set_of_segmentation.label: sets of segmentations
Entity-set_of_segmentation.description: Sets of segmentations refer to multiple distinct segmentations generated from an image, which are used to evaluate the delineation of scene objects in the context of unsupervised object discovery.

Entity-contemporary_method_for_unsupervi.label: contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images
aliases: contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images
Entity-contemporary_method_for_unsupervi.description: Contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images refer to advanced techniques that automatically identify and segment objects within collections of images without the need for labeled training data.

mentions.local_name: contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images

Entity-object_boundary_fragment.label: object boundary fragments
Entity-object_boundary_fragment.description: Object boundary fragments refer to hypothesized segments in an image that indicate the boundaries of objects, which are used to inform partial scene segmentation in the context of unsupervised object discovery.

Entity-unsupervised_object_discovery.label: unsupervised object discovery
Entity-unsupervised_object_discovery.description: Unsupervised object discovery is a machine learning technique in computer vision that aims to identify and segment objects in images without the use of labeled training data.

Entity-segmentation.label: segmentation
Entity-segmentation.description: Segmentation refers to the process of dividing an image into multiple segments or regions, allowing for the identification and delineation of objects within the image, particularly in the context of unsupervised object discovery using techniques such as spectral clustering and image matting.

Entity-hypothesized_object_boundary_frag.label: hypothesized object boundary fragments
aliases: a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments
Entity-hypothesized_object_boundary_frag.description: Hypothesized object boundary fragments refer to conceptual representations of potential boundaries of objects within a scene, which are used to inform and guide the unsupervised segmentation process in image analysis.

mentions.local_name: a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments

Entity-image.label: image
Entity-image.description: The term 'image' refers to a visual representation or digital content that is being segmented into multiple parts for the purpose of unsupervised object discovery in the context of the proposed segmentation methods.

Entity-scene_object.label: scene objects
Entity-scene_object.description: Scene objects refer to the distinct visual elements or entities within an image that are delineated through segmentation techniques, particularly in the context of unsupervised object discovery.

Entity-dataset_of_scene.label: dataset of scenes
Entity-dataset_of_scene.description: The 'dataset of scenes' refers to a collection of images used to qualitatively and quantitatively evaluate a novel approach for unsupervised segmentation of whole objects, facilitating research in unsupervised object discovery.

Entity-a_single__best__segmentation.label: a single '' best '' segmentation
Entity-a_single__best__segmentation.description: A single 'best' segmentation refers to the idealized, optimal division of an image into distinct segments that accurately represent the objects within, which the authors argue against in favor of generating multiple segmentations to better capture the complexity of scenes.

Entity-accurate_and_parsimonious_delinea.label: accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects
aliases: accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects
Entity-accurate_and_parsimonious_delinea.description: The term 'accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects' refers to the precise and efficient identification and representation of objects within a scene, which is essential for evaluating segmentation methods in unsupervised object discovery.

mentions.local_name: accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects

Entity-group_of_image.label: groups of images
Entity-group_of_image.description: groups of images refers to collections of visual data used in unsupervised object discovery, which facilitate the generation of multiple segmentations for scene analysis.

Entity-scene.label: scene
Entity-scene.description: The term 'scene' refers to a visual environment or context within an image that contains objects and their boundaries, which is analyzed for segmentation in the context of unsupervised object discovery.

Entity-boundary_detection.label: boundary detection
Entity-boundary_detection.description: Boundary detection is a technique used in image processing and computer vision to identify the edges or boundaries of objects within an image.

Entity-recent_advance_in_spectral_cluste.label: recent advances in spectral clustering
Entity-recent_advance_in_spectral_cluste.description: Recent advances in spectral clustering refer to the latest developments and improvements in the spectral clustering technique, which is a method used for grouping data points based on the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of similarity matrices, enhancing its application in tasks such as unsupervised segmentation and object discovery.

Entity-image_matting.label: image matting
Entity-image_matting.description: Image matting is an image processing technique used to extract foreground objects from a background by estimating the alpha channel that represents the transparency of each pixel.

Entity-top-down_knowledge.label: top-down knowledge
Entity-top-down_knowledge.description: Top-down knowledge refers to the cognitive approach and understanding that utilizes prior information or context to guide the interpretation and segmentation of visual data, which is contrasted in this paper by the focus on unsupervised object discovery that does not rely on such prior knowledge.

Entity-spectral_clustering.label: spectral clustering
Entity-spectral_clustering.description: Spectral clustering is a data analysis technique that uses the eigenvalues of a similarity matrix to reduce dimensionality before applying a clustering algorithm to group data points based on their similarities.

Entity-dataset.label: dataset
Entity-dataset.description: A dataset is a structured collection of data, often used for analysis, research, or training machine learning models.

summary: We propose a novel step toward the unsupervised seg-mentation of whole objects by combining '' hints '' of partial scene segmentation offered by multiple soft , binary mattes . These mattes are implied by a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments in the scene . Rather than trying to find or define a single '' best '' segmentation , we generate multiple segmentations of an image . This reflects contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images , and it allows us to define intuitive evaluation met-rics for our sets of segmentations based on the accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects . Our proposed approach builds on recent advances in spectral clustering , image matting , and boundary detection . It is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes and is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge .

Predicate-combines.label: combines
Predicate-combines.description: The predicate 'combines' indicates a relationship in which the subject integrates or merges with the object, resulting in a unified entity or concept. This action suggests that the characteristics or elements of the object are brought together with those of the subject to create a new, cohesive whole.

Predicate-are_implied_by.label: are implied by
Predicate-are_implied_by.description: The predicate 'are implied by' establishes a relationship where the subject is suggested or inferred from the characteristics, properties, or conditions represented by the object. It indicates that the existence or nature of the subject can be understood or deduced through the context or information provided by the object, suggesting a dependency or interpretative link between the two.

Predicate-reflects.label: reflects
Predicate-reflects.description: The predicate 'reflects' indicates a relationship where the subject embodies, represents, or demonstrates characteristics, qualities, or aspects of the object. It suggests that the subject serves as a mirror or representation of the object, conveying its essence or underlying principles.

Predicate-allows.label: allows
Predicate-allows.description: The predicate 'allows' indicates that the subject provides the capability, opportunity, or means for the object to occur or be realized. It suggests a permissive or enabling relationship where the subject facilitates the existence, creation, or utilization of the object.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' establishes a foundational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is derived from, influenced by, or constructed upon the principles, criteria, or elements represented by the object. It suggests that the validity, structure, or characteristics of the subject are contingent upon the information or framework provided by the object.

Predicate-are_delineated_by.label: are delineated by
Predicate-are_delineated_by.description: The predicate 'are delineated by' establishes a relationship where the subject is defined or characterized through the process or method described in the object. It indicates that the subject's features, boundaries, or characteristics are made clear or specified by the means outlined in the object, suggesting a connection between the entities that enhances understanding or representation.

Predicate-builds_on.label: builds on
Predicate-builds_on.description: The predicate 'builds on' indicates that the subject is developing or enhancing its capabilities, ideas, or methodologies by utilizing or incorporating elements, concepts, or advancements represented by the object. This relationship suggests a foundation where the subject relies on the established knowledge or progress of the object to create something new or improve upon existing frameworks.

Predicate-is_demonstrated_on.label: is demonstrated on
Predicate-is_demonstrated_on.description: The predicate 'is demonstrated on' indicates a relationship where the subject serves as a source or context that provides evidence, examples, or validation for the object. In this relationship, the subject showcases or illustrates the characteristics, features, or behaviors of the object, thereby allowing for an understanding or analysis of the object through the lens of the subject.

Predicate-is_suitable_for.label: is suitable for
Predicate-is_suitable_for.description: The predicate 'is suitable for' establishes a relationship where the subject is deemed appropriate or fitting for the context or requirements represented by the object. It indicates that the subject possesses qualities, characteristics, or functionalities that align well with the needs or objectives of the object, suggesting a compatibility or relevance between the two.

Predicate-are_generated_by.label: are generated by
Predicate-are_generated_by.description: The predicate 'are generated by' indicates a causal or productive relationship where the subject is the result or output of a process, method, or entity represented by the object. It implies that the object is responsible for creating, producing, or causing the subject to come into existence.

Predicate-integrates_hints_from.label: integrates hints from
Predicate-integrates_hints_from.description: The predicate 'integrates hints from' indicates a process in which the subject incorporates or utilizes information, insights, or cues derived from the object to enhance its functionality, performance, or understanding. This suggests a relationship where the subject benefits from the knowledge or characteristics of the object, leading to a more comprehensive or effective outcome.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or category that falls under the wider classification represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a larger scope or set of entities that includes the subject, thereby facilitating a categorization or taxonomy where the subject is a subset of the object.
